title: A Pittsburgh doctor says Antonio Brown once repeatedly farted in his face during a consultation, and that he owes him $11,500 in unpaid bills
text:
Antonio Brown's former doctor says the 31-year-old once repeatedly farted in his face during a consultation, and that he still owes him $11,500 in unpaid bills.

Dr Victor Prisk, who now owns his own orthopedics and wellness clinic in Pittsburgh, first agreed to meet Brown for a body fat test in 2018, according to Sports Illustrated.

However Brown reportedly turned up three hours late for the meeting, and upon his eventual arrival, preceded to pass gas in Prisk's face and laugh.

The ordeal was filmed by one of Brown's friends — footage which has since been obtained by TMZ.

The video has since been shared on Twitter:

"It seemed just childish to me," Prisk told Sports Illustrated. "I'm a doctor and this man is farting in my face."

Read more: The woman who accused Antonio Brown of rape is meeting with the NFL to discuss her allegations one day after the wide receiver played his first game with the Patriots

Despite the incident, Prisk decided to take Brown on as a regular client, and went on to create diet and supplement programmes for the wide receiver.

Prisk had agreed a fee with Brown of $500 per hour, however he said fees were never paid.

Last month, Prisk says he filed a lawsuit seeking $11,500 in unpaid fees from Brown, which is currently pending.

"He's gonna invest in your business, invest in you. You're part of my family. Call God and all that," Prisk told Sports Illustrated. "But he doesn't do that, and he doesn't even pay the bill."

Read more: 15 players who could be steals to help win your fantasy football league

Prisk's claims add to a growing list of allegations against Brown.

The New England Patriots star was recently accused of rape by his former trainer Britney Taylor, who filed a lawsuit against him last week.

A second, unnamed woman has also accused Brown of sexual assault, according to Sports Illustrated.

Brown and his legal team have denied both claims of sexual assault.

According to the Bleacher Report, police have also been involved with at least three domestic disputes involving Brown in the last four years.

Brown scored his first touchdown for the Patriots in a 43-0 win over the Miami Dolphins on Sunday.
description: TMZ has obtained footage of the appointment with Dr Victor Prisk, which was filmed by one of Brown's friends.
